name: io.bytes.per.checksum
description:
The number of bytes per checksum.  Must not be larger than
  io.file.buffer.size.

name: dfs.content-summary.sleep-microsec
description:
The length of time in microseconds to put the thread to sleep, between reaquiring the locks
    in content summary computation.

name: fs.s3a.attempts.maximum
description: How many times we should retry commands on transient errors.

name: mapreduce.job.running.map.limit
description:
The maximum number of simultaneous map tasks per job.
  There is no limit if this value is 0 or negative.

name: mapreduce.map.maxattempts
description:
Expert: The maximum number of attempts per map task.
  In other words, framework will try to execute a map task these many number
  of times before giving up on it.

name: dfs.client.max.block.acquire.failures
description: Maximum failures allowed when trying to get block information from a specific datanode.

name: file.stream-buffer-size
description:
The size of buffer to stream files.
  The size of this buffer should probably be a multiple of hardware
  page size (4096 on Intel x86), and it determines how much data is
  buffered during read and write operations.

name: ipc.[port_number].decay-scheduler.period-ms
description:
How frequently the decay factor should be applied to the
    operation counts of users. Higher values have less overhead, but respond
    less quickly to changes in client behavior.
    This property applies to DecayRpcScheduler.

name: dfs.namenode.fs-limits.max-directory-items
description:
Defines the maximum number of items that a directory may
      contain. Cannot set the property to a value less than 1 or more than
      6400000.
